choiceModel

Class RSUET

  • java.lang.Object
    • choiceModel.RouteChoiceModel
      • choiceModel.RSUET
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RSUE

    public class RSUET
extends RouteChoiceModel
    This class of route choice models, originated from Thomas Kj√¶r Rasmussen of the Technical University of Denmark, has extremely attractive computational properties when the lower reference cost phi function equals RefCostMin
    Author:
    mesch
    See Also:
    RUM, RefCostFun

    • Field Detail

      • d

        public int d
        d for gamma in RSUET(min,omega)

      • epsilon

        public double epsilon
        The maximum allowed sum of gap measures for the for a solution to be considered an equilibrium.

      • Nmin

        public int Nmin
        The minimum number of routes present in a restricted choice set for doThresholdConditionPhase to remove one path. By default, this is set to 2 so that at least one route is present at equilibrium and that routes may never be removed when there are no other used paths in the same OD relation.

      • Kmin

        public int Kmin
        Threshold-violating paths are potentially removed in algorithms by doThresholdConditionPhase if and only if the iteration number is no smaller than Kmin.

      • itmax

        public int itmax
        The iteration number at which the algorithm will "give up" trying to reach equilibrium.

      • phi

        RefCostFun phi
        Reference cost function that determines which routes must be used

      • omega

        RefCostFun omega
        Reference cost function that determines which routes must be unused

      • dForUniversalChoiceSetAlgTMNL

        public int dForUniversalChoiceSetAlgTMNL
        This integer is used by Utils.gamma(int, int) to determine how much the auxiliary solution is trusted during the algorithmic phase. The higher the integer, the more trusted is the provisional flow. The value specified here is used for cutUniversalChoiceSetAlgorithm when the RUM is of type TMNL.
        See Also:
        Utils.gamma(int, int), cutUniversalChoiceSetAlgorithm(Network)

      • dForUniversalChoiceSetAlgMNL

        public int dForUniversalChoiceSetAlgMNL
        This integer is used by Utils.gamma(int, int) to determine how much the auxiliary solution is trusted during the algorithmic phase. The higher the integer, the more trusted is the provisional flow. The value specified here is used for cutUniversalChoiceSetAlgorithm when the RUM is of type MNL or PSL.
        See Also:
        Utils.gamma(int, int), cutUniversalChoiceSetAlgorithm(Network)

      • maximumCostRatio

        public double maximumCostRatio
        To avoid manipulating irrelevant routes in the universal choice set in cutUniversalChoiceSetAlgorithm, only routes where path.gencost <= maximumCostRatio*path.od.getMinimumCost() are considered.

             RefCostFun phi,
             RefCostFun omega)
        Only class constructor, since the RSUET requires two reference costs in order to make sense.

        phi - the lower reference cost function
        omega - the upper reference cost function

      • columnGenerationAlgorithm

        private ConvergencePattern columnGenerationAlgorithm(Network network,
                                                     RefCostFun phi,
                                                     RefCostFun omega,
                                                     java.lang.String... varargs)

      • columnGenerationAlgorithm

        private ConvergencePattern columnGenerationAlgorithm(Network network,
                                                     java.lang.String... varargs)
        Used by the solution algorithm when the lower reference cost is RefCostMin. This is because a shortest path search can be used to determine if the used cost condition is met; "column generation" refers to the inclusion of new paths by a shortest path search.
        Parameters:
        network - the network to solve
        varargs - options to pass; "suppress" will stop the method from printing gap measures.
        Returns:
        the convergence pattern that the algorithm returned

      • computeEnumeratorInProbabilityExpression

        public double computeEnumeratorInProbabilityExpression(Path path)
        Specified by:
        computeEnumeratorInProbabilityExpression in class RouteChoiceModel

      • cutUniversalChoiceSetAlgorithm

        private ConvergencePattern cutUniversalChoiceSetAlgorithm(Network network)
        An inefficient, proof-of-concept experimental implementation of the RSUET when the reference cost Phi is not the "min" function. It is not advised to use this algorithm on larger networks, since it enumerates the universal choice set. Perhaps future implementations should instead use a k-shortest path algorithm.

        To speed up computation times, this algorithm heuristically cuts off more expensive routes that with a high degree of likelihood would not have flow assigned to them anyway.

        The initial flow solution used is obtained by an RSUET with similar parameters to the TMNL.

        Parameters:
        network - the network to solve
        Returns:
        convergence pattern, with two unused gap measures: above and below

      • doThresholdConditionPhase

        private boolean doThresholdConditionPhase(Network network,
                                          int n)
        Removes routes from restricted choice sets that violate the threshold defined by the reference cost omega. Redistributes the flow on removed routes.
        Parameters:
        network - the network which is being solved
        n - the iteration number
        Returns:
        true is something was removed, false otherwise

      • getDToUseInUniversalChoiceSetAlg

        private int getDToUseInUniversalChoiceSetAlg()
        Heuristically decides which weighting parameter for Utils.gamma(int, int) to use for cutUniversalChoiceSetAlgorithm(Network).
        Returns:
        the d to be used for Utils.gamma(int, int) in the MSA

      • printParamToFile

        public void printParamToFile(java.io.File file)
                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method prints details about the route choice model, i.e. the RSUET. This method does not override anything, since there is no general implementation of a "print" function of RouteChoiceModels.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to print parameters to.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Throws an exception if the file could not be written.

      • printParamToFile

        public void printParamToFile(java.lang.String filename)

        Prints gap measures in the RSUE
        Parameters:
        time - the time to be printed
        See Also:

      • printTmnl

        private void printTmnl(int iterationNumber,
                       double gapUnusedAbove,
                       double gapUnusedBelow,
                       double gapUsed)
        Prints gap measures in the TMNL
        Parameters:
        iterationNumber - the iteration number to print
        gapUnusedAbove - the unused gap above to print
        gapUnusedBelow - the unused gap below to print
        gapUsed - the used gap to print
        See Also:
        cutUniversalChoiceSetAlgorithm(Network)

      • redistributeFlowOnMarkedRoutesAccordingToProbability

        public void redistributeFlowOnMarkedRoutesAccordingToProbability(Network network,
                                                                 int maxNumberOfPathsToRemove)
        used by the RSUET(phi,omega) algorithm where phi is greater than "min". to remove up to maxNumberOfPathsToRemove paths and redistribute their flow acording to the the choice probability of the remaining routes.
        Parameters:
        maxNumberOfPathsToRemove - the maximum number of routes that are removed
        network - the network to perform redistribution on
        See Also:
        solve(Network)

      • redistributeFlowOnMarkedRoutesMaxRelativeFlow

        private void redistributeFlowOnMarkedRoutesMaxRelativeFlow(Network network,
                                                           double maxPercentFlowToRemove)
        Alternative route removal method to redistributeFlowOnMarkedRoutesAccordingToProbability(Network, int). Not currently used.
        Parameters:
        network - the network on which to perform the operation
        maxPercentFlowToRemove - the maximum allowed share of the total demand on the route to remove. If that the maximum amount is removed, an equal share is removed from all violating routes, relative to their original flow. Otherwise, all flow on violating routes is removed.

      • redistributeFlowOnMostViolatingRoute

        private void redistributeFlowOnMostViolatingRoute(Network network)
        Removes all flow on only the most violating route and redistributes it to the remaining routes according to their choice probability. Not currently used.
        Parameters:
        network - the network on which to perform the operation

      • relGapAbove

        public double relGapAbove(Network network)
        This is the relative gap on unused routes above the threshold for TMNL as defined in the working paper by Thomas Kj√¶r Rasmussen.
        Parameters:
        network - the network on which to evaluate the gap from equilibrium due to unused routes
        Returns:
        the gap on unused routes

      • relGapBelow

        public double relGapBelow(Network network)
        This is the relative gap on unused routes below the threshold for TMNL as defined in the working paper by Thomas Kj√¶r Rasmussen.
        Parameters:
        network - the network on which to evaluate the gap from equilibrium due to unused routes
        Returns:
        the gap on unused routes

        public ConvergencePattern solve(Network network)
        Description copied from class: RouteChoiceModel
        Route choice models in this context are objects which can model the assignment of demand as flow on a network. They may have a random utility model, and must always have the methods
        Specified by:
        solve in class RouteChoiceModel
        Parameters:
        network - the Network to get to equilibrium in.
        Returns:
        a convergence pattern that shows how the solution algorithm fared
